Sentencas: Manganese cobalt spinel oxide coatings have been shown to be effective for preventing chromium volatilization from interconnect alloys and associated cathode poisoning in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: A reaction layer consisting of chromium-containing spinel formed due to interaction of the coating with the chromia scale on the alloy surface and increases the overall area specific resistance (ASR) of the system.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: Reduction in ASR can be accomplished by reducing the thickness and/or increasing the electrical conductivity of the reaction layer, which includes both the high-chromium spinel phase and the chromia scale.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: This paper reports the effects of transition metal dopants in manganese-cobalt spinel on the reaction products and chromia scale formed on a ferritic stainless steel alloy.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: Dense single-phase doped spinel ceramics were prepared through process optimization.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: High temperature diffusion couple experiments with sintered spinel and ferritic stainless steel SS 441 were carried out to understand the spinel-alloy interactions.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: Doping of the spinel oxide led to a reduction in the thickness of the chromia scale formed on the alloy.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects

Sentencas: The difference in the morphologies and compositions of interaction layers at 800 C and 900 degrees C provides insight on the formation and growth mechanism of a high-chromium spinel.
Titulo: Transition Metal Doping of Manganese Cobalt Spinel Oxides for Coating SOFC Interconnects
